programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders go to Santa Cruz for one of the most hotly anticipated auctions of the year.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys get a taste of the Wild West when they value a 19th-century revolver. They also examine a set of Elvis Presley's medical records.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys inspect a document signed by one of America's founding fathers and a Rickenbacker electric guitar from the 1930s.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds' million-dollar art deal takes more twists and turns, but eventually Les shakes hands on the single biggest purchase in store history.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les shocks the others when he reveals his plans to buy a new store. Meanwhile, a man wanting to pawn his VCR causes a scene, and another tries to get money for his fake eye.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The Old Man from Pawn Stars has an unusual assignment for the team, and Roli fails to impress his colleagues with his latest custom job.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny Koker and the Count's Kustoms crew revisit some of the most outrageous rides ever featured on the show.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Marc Springer transports a car, only for it to suffer weather damage during the journey. Jarrett Joyce finds he may have more cargo than he can fit into his truck when he arrives to collect three chicken coops.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.sub-title: From Sphere to Infinity and Beyond
programme.desc: Chris and Robbie are pulled over by the police while driving in Arizona, and Roy finally reveals a softer side to his nature when he offers to deliver a coin-operated ride to a boy who has just lost his father.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The story of a waitress who was poisoned in Florida, and how one of the strangest sting operations in the state's history led police to an unlikely killer.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: A series of drunken nights makes one woman a regular returner to the parking lot.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Michele and Sonja clamp a car belonging to a woman whose husband may have accumulated a pile of tickets on her vehicle.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange lights, a government cover-up and something odd above the woods - experts revisit the Swedish Mora UFO photos, Mussolini's UFO files and the Rendlesham forest incident.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Return of the weapons-crafting contest. Five novice smiths take part, and the two left standing must re-create a 16th-century weapon known as the war golok.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are challenged to salvage a cannon to make signature blades. The finalists recreate the North African Kabyle Flyssa, a blade traditionally used to break mail armour.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A hustler tries to make Les an offer he cannot refuse, but the Golds fight back and turn the tables on the shady customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley plays a prank on Seth to teach him a lesson about locking his door - but Seth evens the score with a practical joke of his own. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the Golds uncover a series of bogus pawns, their investigation leads to a trusted employee and a confession. Reality series about the running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Seth visit a customer with a garage full of vintage cars. Against his children's wishes, Les offers big money for one of the owner's golden oldies.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny Grumbles competes against her rivals to buy the locker of her dreams, while one of her fellow bidders demonstrates a darker side.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A stranger on a motorbike drives up the prices at an auction in DeSoto, where there are only four lockers up for grabs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers make some risky bids when they attend an auction at Fort Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny brings her mother to an auction, and Moe annoys Mary by bidding for a risky locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary and Moe compete with a huge crowd of bidders, and the locker they are after is guaranteed to make Moe's wife angry.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Take a Deep Breath, It's Lesa
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Conroe, where they come face to face with an old adversary.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a recording of a speech by Martin Luther King, a withdrawn poster for Return of the Jedi, and a 1962 US postage printing plate.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team assesses the value of a one-man submarine, a tiny Model T Ford and an officer's commission from the American Revolution.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a battered Evel Knievel pinball machine, a collection of antique glass eyes, and a signed photograph of baseball player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team ponders whether to buy a watch formerly owned by convicted fraudster Bernie Madoff, and also considers a 1950s bowling game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cheerleader visits the shop to pawn her ring from the 1989 Super Bowl, and there is a chance to buy a motor home.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers consider buying a straitjacket that belonged to Harry Houdini, a letter from activist Helen Keller and a loudspeaker from the Brooklyn Dodgers' stadium.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over top-secret wartime documents, while Corey tries to get a good price for a toy from the 1970s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop owners value a Cold War era heat-seeking missile guidance system, deliberate over a Playboy bunny uniform, and check out a 1986 Buick Regal motor car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys get a taste of the Wild West when they value a 19th-century revolver. They also examine a set of Elvis Presley's medical records.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys inspect a document signed by one of America's founding fathers and a Rickenbacker electric guitar from the 1930s.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries. Alongside experts, he explores the puzzling construction of Puma Punku in Bolivia, contemplating whether advanced technology could have been used to carve the ancient temple complex.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Jim and Bill Vieira track promising leads on the Goshen Mystery Tunnel site, and a giant skeleton found in 1849.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: After years of searching, the team may have located an artefact that has been missing for more than a century. In Smith's Cove, brothers Marty and Rick Lagina struggle to hold back the waters.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: After months of tireless effort, Rick, Marty and the team begin the massive excavation at Smith's Cove and almost immediately strike gold.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Cat takes time off from being in love with himself to fall head over heels in love with a lady Cat with a big secret. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Carl Donnelly, Jo Caulfield and Milton Jones join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from June 2012.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Gary Delaney and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from July 2012.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Chris Packham, actor Paul Feig, comedian Jon Richardson and historian Kate Williams join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Ben, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: An evening of comedy at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Ventriloquist Nina Conti comperes the event, with a little help from her monkey, before introducing routines by stand-up stars Rob Beckett and Jimeoin.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave suggests revamping the calendar and considers the upshot of buying Twitter followers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets out to discover if driving a Lamborghini Murcielago roadster gives drivers the same kick as 12 angry bulls, and whether the Top Gear theme tune can be played with engines. The Ford F150 SVT Lightning pick-up is put through its paces, the world's greatest power sliders hit the track, and Timothy Spall is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Vic and Bob, Theo Paphitis, Janet Street Porter, Stephen K Amos, Justin Moorhouse, Ellie Taylor and Phil Tufnell take part in Lewes. Sean Kelly hosts.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look back on their trickiest excavations ever, including relics buried underground and awesome finds trapped under mountains of junk.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: Have Yourself a Merry Pickers Christmas
programme.desc: Mike tries to put Frank in a Christmas mood with two trips in search of precious objects.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: CS gas is used to stop a crazed axeman, a drunk student cannot understand why he's being arrested and a joker insults a cop but uses his charm to avoid arrest.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The world's biggest air package handling facility at UPS Worldport, which sorts two million items per night for worldwide delivery. Fireman also tackle a mock air freighter inferno.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets out to discover if driving a Lamborghini Murcielago roadster gives drivers the same kick as 12 angry bulls, and whether the Top Gear theme tune can be played with engines. The Ford F150 SVT Lightning pick-up is put through its paces, the world's greatest power sliders hit the track, and Timothy Spall is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guests Fern Britton, Stephen Mangan, Ken Livingstone and Reginald D Hunter join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jimmy Carr and Marcus Brigstocke, TV presenter Terry Christian and singer Jamelia join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jack Whitehall and Frankie Boyle, TV presenter Christine Bleakley and journalist Kelvin MacKenzie join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy arranges a special surprise for Lee's birthday, which sees their family and friends joining them in a Crystal Maze-style physical adventure game where the objective is to escape from a series of rooms. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A missing toy keyring leads to a rift between Lee and Lucy and their best friends and former neighbours Toby and Anna. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe).

credits.actor: a guest appearance from former EastEndersAnnette Badland (Aunt Babe)

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Carl Donnelly, Jo Caulfield and Milton Jones join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from June 2012.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Gary Delaney and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from July 2012.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Tesla automotive manufacturing facility, where the world's strongest robots produce 2000 cars a week. Featuring a comparison with the world's first production line.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: As Hitler's ambitions spread beyond Germany, the world drew toward another great war. This one would be fought on many battlefields, but also for the hearts and minds of the people.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians explore the life of the South Devon branch line before the Beeching cuts of the 1960s. Peter Ginn joins a footplate crew and receives coal-shovelling tips from a veteran steam engine driver of 63 years' experience, and with Alex he learns about one of Scotland's most lucrative exports. Ruth Goodman finds out about the dangers involved in working on the Victorian railways, and how those who lost limbs were catered for by a dedicated prosthetics workshop. She also discovers how the railways came to the rescue when a deadly disease wiped out almost the entire stock of London cattle.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Juan Borgia: A Death in the Dynasty
programme.desc: The infamous Borgia family was devastated when favourite son Juan was murdered in 1497. Here, modern experts set about cracking the case and fingering the killer.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates whether the Knights Templar hid their treasure, looted from Jerusalem, on an uninhabited island in Mahone Bay, Nova Scotia.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Portugal to meet leading experts on the Three Secrets of Fatima - a series of visions and prophecies allegedly given by the Virgin Mary to three young shepherds in 1917.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Performances by punk and new wave acts on the music show in 1977, including the Stranglers and the Jam, plus the continuing power of disco exemplified by Donna Summer's I Feel Love, the reggae of Bob Marley and pub rock by acts such as Eddie and the Hot Rods. Insight into performing on the programme comes from musicians including John Otway, JJ Burnel of the Stranglers, Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols, members of Darts and the Adverts, as well as contributions from Nicky Wire, Alexis Petridis and Pete Paphides.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team attends a triple murder at a farmhouse, where the investigating detective, Supt Tom Byrne, wastes no time making his presence felt. The pathologists soon make a breakthrough when DNA found at the scene matches that of a mysterious female serial killer - although Nikki has cause to question the direction they are heading in. The case is proving difficult for Leo, however, whose mind is in turmoil following the suicide of an old friend. Guest starring Vincent Regan and Shelley Conn.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Tensions rise as the two sisters disagree over the final designs for their fashion collection, and when Evie decides to move out, both their careers and relationships are threatened. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: After finally deciding on a theme for the forthcoming collection, the girls are introduced to a renowned fashion writer - who all but ruins their career. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An overzealous taxman sets out to snare Lovejoy - not to mention an axe-wielding jailbird determined to retrieve an ornate Arab head-dress. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plans an elaborate double-cross to get his hands on a pair of valuable Meissen figurines, sold to Lovejoy by a woman who needed some quick cash to buy drugs. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim unwittingly finds himself caught up in a drug operation while babysitting a pair of difficult girls in the South of France. Drama, starring John Nettles, Therese Liotard and Pippa Guard.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie helps a charity appeal for a war hero, while a newspaper advert lands Jim with a disreputable client, much to his regret. Crime drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Maverick British rifleman Richard Sharpe is promoted for saving General Wellesley's life, and sent behind enemy lines to rally Spanish support. Surrounded by the French, he manages to pull off an inspiring propaganda coup in the small town of Torrecastro. Swashbuckling adventure, featuring Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes and starring Sean Bean and Brian Cox.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Wingless Bird
programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Agnes faces an added dilemma when she finds her heart divided between Charles and his soldier brother Reginald. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Return of the detective drama. Mike and his team are drawn into a world of Victorian dress-up and escapism when they investigate a murder at a Brokenwood steampunk event.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Theodore Roosevelt sneaks into Canada for a hunting trip, but Murdoch discovers that the American president is the prey of a killer.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: When famed French designer Coco Chanel is the target of a brazen assassination attempt, Frankie and the team are hired to protect her. Period crime drama, starring Lauren Lee Smith.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Eliza's other grandmother, Dinah, makes a dramatic entrance, but why is she really back?.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Meryl and Ajax compete for the seat on the council, while Penny and Jarrod are planning to elope, but who will break the news to Hugh?.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.desc: Alex Crawford joins South African rangers battling rhino poaching and Stuart Ramsay's team face the dangers of filming in the Amazon.

programme.desc: Documentary following the story of a cunning fraudster who posed as an MI6 agent to con his ex-girlfriend out of almost 300,000

programme.title: Sky News at 10

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The latest group of men entering the 'love lift' are a tech-savvy personal trainer, an airline pilot, a magician and musician, and a city banker, all hoping to impress a studio full of single women and win a date - but must first get the 30 female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Paddy McGuinness presents.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000. Taking part this time round are Feel the Burn from Blackburn, and the Exe Rays - a team of medical students from Exeter.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: An incident at an orbiting space hub calls for the staff of International Rescue to give their operation a massive overhaul, one that will make Thunderbird Two capable of venturing into space.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on one of the UK's toughest obstacle courses, but can he beat the clock and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz falls into the sewers, only to bump into Magoo, who thinks he's exploring the jungle. The latter mistakes Fizz for a lost child..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally spills all of Mrs. Wicket's new, expensive perfume on the floor. Can he hide the crime and cover his tracks?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses..

programme.title: LEGO Jurassic World: The Legend of Isla Nublar
Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: With Vambre on a break, Prohyas ropes Noville in to solve a mystery where letters are disappearing from books. Can they do it with having to call Vambre?.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by McFly's Dougie Poynter and chefs Brian Turner and Nisha Katona. Dr Hazel Wallace will be making perfect packed lunches and Oz Clarke continues his tour of some of Britain's best pubs.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo tours his homeland by train, taking in some of some of the most scenic train journeys in Europe. He begins in the French Alpine town of Breil-sur-Roya, so he can travel into Italy in style. Once in his own country, he meets a doctor who does his rounds on horseback, and visits hazelnut groves where he prepares a chocolate cheesecake. In Turin, he fulfils a lifelong dream of racing on top of the world-famous Lingotto rooftop track and makes his final dish - fettuccine pasta with mascarpone and pork mince.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha joins forces with chef Zoe Adjonyoh to create a family feast from Africa. The menu comprises red bean stew for breakfast, Ghanaian spiced chicken kebabs for lunch, Zoe's peanut butter stew for dinner and Nadia's puff puff doughnuts for dessert.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Haydock
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 3.00 Betfair Steeple Chase, and races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.40 from Haydock Park. Plus, races from 2.05, 2.44 and 3.20 at Ascot. With analysis from AP McCoy and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Oli Bell, Luke Harvey, Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Westlife's Nicky Byrne, Olympian Amy Williams, Natalie Cassidy (EastEnders' Sonia Jackson) and Dave Myers of The Hairy Bikers pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents the show in which a group of men enters the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Today's contestants are a carnival dancer, a magician, a city worker and a sports therapist.

programme.title: The X Factor: Celebrity
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary hosts the star-studded version of the singing contest, in which the line-up of famous faces leave their comfort zones and take to the stage to perform - and while some have proved to be naturals, others have struggled somewhat. Simon Cowell mentors the Groups, Nicole Scherzinger is in charge of the Overs, and Louis Walsh handles the Unders, and as usual the judges are each allowed to send one act through to next week by pushing the golden buzzer, leaving the rest at the mercy of the voting public.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the celebrity survival challenge reality show. As the second week in the jungle begins, the campmates are already starting to feel tired and hungry - but they must still face the dreaded Bushtucker Trial.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined in the studio by comedian, author and Britain's Got Talent judge David Walliams and Edward Norton, who has recently directed his second movie, crime drama Motherless Brooklyn. Also dropping in are the stars of the new Charlie's Angels movie, Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska, and Robbie Williams, who will be performing live.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological processes involved in making car batteries and toothbrushes. Plus, the method used to convert cacao beans into chocolate.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for the Bond Bug, a three-wheeled 1970s British sports car, hoping that if he can acquire one his expert mechanic Edd China can make it roadworthy once more.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a 1933 Duesenberg SJ that has not been taken out on the road for 30 years, and hopes a heated garage has done a good job of keeping the vehicle in top shape.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia on the orders of a client seeking a 69 ZL-1 Coupe Chevrolet Camaro, and attend the sale of Milt Robson's muscle car collection.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of construction disasters, sneaky drivers catching everyone off-guard and oblivious pedestrians causing chaos.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Criminals try to outrun the law and a man attempts to get into a fight with the driver of a giant freight truck.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A drag boat disintegrates while travelling at 180mph, a huge explosion rips through the roof of a dormitory and a sprint car crashes at 120mph.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A fuel transfer causes multiple explosions, a base jumper is swept into a raging waterfall and a man is saved from drowning after his helicopter crashes into water.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: The team members work to complete the Clowham job without damaging the ecosystem, but upon returning home, a change of plan has them rushing back to the site.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team revamp a Chevrolet pick-up truck in memory of a man's father-in-law.

programme.title: Pacific Warriors
programme.desc: Jon tries to impress a local to gain access to a secret marlin hunting ground, while Kimi hunts an invasive species that is hindering her food supply.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The team hits the track to test out the new Volvo XC40. Plus, Jimmy de Ville goes back to the '80s to find out how Audi devised the revolutionary four-wheel drive system.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys a run-down Porsche 928, which leaves Edd China doubtful about their chances of getting the car back on the road again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer meets the proud owner of a Porsche 928 which is in good condition, while Edd China adds the finishing touches to the restoration project.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China make a Ford Capri 1.6 Laser roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China complete work on the Ford Capri 1.6 Laser.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to Poland to source an FSM Syrena, but with the model being virtually unknown outside of the country, he and Edd China could struggle to make a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer enlists mechanic Edd China's help to restore an AMC Pacer. However, a strict budget means their ideas for the 1970s hatchback will need to be credible as well as costed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The team wants to tackle an eco-friendly build, and Mike makes it happen when he picks up an original Econobox, a 1977 Honda CVCC, in need of a rebuilt engine.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Ken Cage and Danny Thompson repossess a tour bus, Kevin Lacey faces armed guards, and Mike Kennedy is caught in a gun-smuggling operation.

programme.title: Aircrash Confidential
programme.desc: The part cockpit mistakes have played in aviation disasters, and whether measures taken by airlines to eliminate human error have gone too far.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Brother and sister team Robbie and Ashleigh hit house removal hell on a mud-bogged mission out of Brisbane. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo battle storms in remote Western Australia.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to buy a rare German Hetzer tank from Russian oligarch Slava, who will need some persuading.

programme.title: Formula E
programme.desc: Highlights from the second-round race in Ad Diriyah, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a fledgling antiques business run by an enterprising young couple in London. Plus, he faces punishing negotiations at a living history museum in Surrey.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard delves into the history of print on London's Fleet Street. Plus, in Devon, he indulges his passion for architectural salvage.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton hopes to buy a rare German Hetzer tank from Russian oligarch Slava, who will need some persuading.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents notice a pattern emerging when they investigate a series of violent carjackings around Washington DC in 1992.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Poisons can be deadly and are often almost impossible to detect. Forensic experts show how they can solve these mysterious deaths.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: The murder of Beverly Puccio, whose body was found by an oddly behaving ex-boyfriend. Police used security and traffic cam footage to piece together her final moments.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The stabbing of Arkansas cheerleader Julie Heath in October 1993. Eric Nance raped and murdered the 18-year-old, and 12 years later was put to death for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a man who abducted a girl from a bus stop before assaulting her fled from the police, leaving a trail of theft and violence.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team faces a race against time to rescue Barney, a beagle that wandered into a storm drain and became trapped.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An unusual patient turns up in the form of an albino echidna, and Chris is invited to Symbio Wildlife Park to carry out a highly dangerous procedure on a female Sumatran tiger.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: With Alaska coming up short, Liz has flown 4,000 miles to find a dress, while Amanda has exhausted all options in Europe and has high hopes for the salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah has come to the salon with her heart set on a particular lace dress, Erika arrives for her third fitting and Kelly is certain she wants one specific dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Kate is engaged for the fifth time and clearly has trouble making decisions, while Jackie wants a dress for a ceremony at which she and her husband will be renewing their vows.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It's a first for Dr Chris Brown as he tests his skills against fast-moving turtles. A hungry pup is in danger of hurting itself after starting to eat things that it shouldn't.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim has his hands full with some lively little Tasmanian Devils, Chris meets a pug with an overly long tongue and Lisa fears for a ragdoll cat's weak legs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who has spent 10 years in bed turns to a doctor for help with losing weight. However, Lupe may have left it too late to to begin her journey.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. At over 700lbs, Brianne is on a weight-loss journey to save her life. However, she faces another shock when her husband's health suddenly deteriorates.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. At over 700lbs, Brianne is on a weight-loss journey to save her life. However, she faces another shock when her husband's health suddenly deteriorates.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Saralyn is in need of two dresses to share her wedding with her sister, and Rachel brings her sibling to help her make a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kara wants a red dress for her big day, but her future mother-in-law has more traditional ideas. Meanwhile, Sheena needs a gown for her Indian wedding reception.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Dina searches for a dress that is as sassy as she is. Meanwhile, Laure wants a simple lace gown for her big day, but the people around her have different ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Precious looks for a gown to suit her new body following weight-loss surgery, while Stefanie wants a simple dress, but her family has other ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not What I Had in Mind
programme.desc: Broadway dancer LaQuet is looking for a fun dress with straps to cover her arms as she walks down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Emily, a lawyer by day and rock singer by night, wants to contrast her normal all-black style with a traditional lace wedding gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The death of the fiance's mother makes bride-to-be Amanda's dress fitting tough, as the consultant also knew the deceased and they had all planned to be present at the ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'll Know It When I See It
programme.desc: Brooke is looking for a special gown - it has to be unique and she won't settle for anything else. Unfortunately, nothing seemingly lives up to her expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nikasha wants to look like a grown woman on her wedding day, but her father would like her to appear the way she did on her sixteenth birthday.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Cindy and her mother hope to find a big, regal ball gown, and are surprised when her sister and best friend fly in from Miami.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa feels nervous ahead of her first colonoscopy, and a man hopes to connect with his deceased wife.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Larry is taking part in a charity motorcycle event, but Theresa is too scared to ride with him on the bike, and a man who blames himself for his son's death meets the medium.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Larry Jr announces he is moving in with his girlfriend, but Theresa insists the couple get engaged first. Later, she passes on a message from a spirit.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: The whole family is still dealing with the loss of their dog Petey, and Theresa gives a reading to a sceptical woman who lost both her parents.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: A woman with obsessive-compulsive disorder hopes to spend just $20 on the reception for her vow renewals, and Gia tries to make dinner for her big family for under $100

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: A 15-year-old boy hides coupons under his pillow to deter thieves, and a woman takes her husband on supersaver shopping trips.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of serial killer Robert Maudsley reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of his murderous intentions?.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Delroy Grant: The Hunt for the Night Stalker
programme.desc: For 17 years, a serial attacker raped elderly victims in their own homes in south London. This documentary reveals how officers caught culprit Delroy Grant who operated in the area between October 1992 and May 2009.

programme.title: Ted Bundy: Mind of a Monster
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary providing an insight into the mind of the serial killer, using archive footage, interviews with victims' friends and family, and the voice of Bundy himself.
